result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve Robert Endter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: (CONCURRENT to counts #4 and #5 on case 2014CF3456) and (CONSECUTIVE to count #3 on case 2014CF3456)

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for 
   the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No violence toward victim, Lynn E.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.  Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Defendant to sign releases to allow the agent to contact physician and pharmacy to ensure that he is complying with treatment and meds.
Parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review. Probation review hearing to be requested by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve Robert Endter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steve Robert Endter not in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

Defendant Steve Robert Endter in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Steve Robert Endter in custody.  
Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:Lynn Endter. 

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to counts #4 and #5 on case 2014CF3456) and (CONSECUTIVE to count #3 on case 2014CF3456), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
   Defendant to sign releases to allow the agent to contact 
   physician and pharmacy to ensure that he is 
   complying with treatment and meds.
* Parenting class.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violence toward victim, Lynn E.   
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of probation 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for 
   the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**PROBATION REVIEW HEARING TO BE REQUESTED BY AGENT.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  mld

Defendant Steve Robert Endter in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Steve Robert Endter in custody.  
Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Pleah Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  mld
with all prior conditions of bail continued.  mld

Defendant Steve Robert Endter in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Steve Robert Endter in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  All available discovery was provided to defense counsel from the State.  Global offer on both cases will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State  

Court ordered that the cash bail on case 2015CF284 be increased to $2,500.00.         

Statement made by Lynne E.  

Court ordered case for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lynne E

Defendant Steve Robert Endter in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Steve Robert Endter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
